answerText: Cannizzaro reaction[10] Disproportionation is a type of this reaction, which describes all chemical reactions in which atoms have their oxidation state changed.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Minnesota A  | 7 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A variant of this reaction is the "crossed" variety, which uses formaldehyde as a reducing agent. For 10 points each: [10] Name this reaction, a base-induced disproportionation of aldehydes lacking a hydrogen atom to carboxylic acids and alcohols.
